intro: Bulbostylis pusilla subsp. yalingensis, commonly known as the Yaling marsh grass, is a small herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering stems are usually short and produce tiny, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
